#Shoeoftheday that describe my personality. Read below ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ğŸ’• Today was a really humbling day at the gym. I get excited at the struggle and the hustle of movements and/or exercises that push me out of my comfort zone. It just means I'll be getting stronger. It just means my body will learn something new. And while I might hate it at the moment (tight chest, muscles burning, the challenge of wanting to accomplish a task so badly and yet, failing. ), I just say to myself "it's only for a few minutes...you got this"-"progress, not perfection". Some people look at failure negatively, but I just continue to look at the things I cannot accomplish at the moment, as motivation to work on myself...to work on something new and exciting.

The fact that I am not where I want to be, it's enough motivation to get me through the day, the week, the year!

Let's get it...@mawarriors

WWW.MASSYARIAS.COM
#motivation #childofgod #nike #justdoit

Meatless Mondays with this ğŸŒ¿ Bowl of goodness . Would you eat this everyday? READ BELOW... ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ Grilled eggplant,  cherry tomatoes, avocado, zuccini, and steamed Brussels spouts on a bed of three types of lentils and brown rice medley sprinkled with balsamic vinegar. 
There's so many micronutrients in this bowl. But the dietary fiber is one to really point out here. If you want to fight constipation, curve hunger and cravings then ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ ğŸ˜ŒğŸŒ¿ Quick fact about my good friend Dietary fiber:Unlike other food components, such as fats, proteins or carbohydrates which your body breaks down and absorbs, fiber isn't digested by your body. It just passes relatively intact through your stomach, small intestine and colon and out of your coconuts ğŸ¤£

So even though 1 cup of lentils has 39g carbs, 15g is dietary fiber, and 18 grams of pure protein. 28g of protein in total counting all the veggies in the bowl. 
It starts from the inside out. Whole foods are indeed medicine.
